alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Saline and central Pulaski Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Lonsdale, or 11 miles east of Hot Springs Village, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Benton... Sherwood... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Hot Springs Village... Downtown Little Rock... North Little Rock Airport... Southwest Little Rock... Shannon Hills... Wrightsville... Argenta... Otter Creek... Ironton... Protho Junction... Lakewood... Camp Robinson... Geyer Springs... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 119 and 142. Interstate 40 between mile markers 147 and 157. Interstate 430 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 530 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 630 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 440 between mile markers 1 and 5. US Highway 67 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
